title: Should I quit my job? Why people have quit their last jobs | Metro News
text:
Alice Sholl for Metro.co.uk Monday 20 Feb 2017 7:26 am We’ve all been tempted (Picture: Shutterstock) 
Whether it’s a bullying boss or being overworked, we all have a final straw that’ll make us turn around and say ‘f*ck it, I quit’. Photo series reveals what bedrooms look like around the world 
And while you might think your story is the worst, over on Reddit , people are sharing the moments at their old jobs that made them walk out of the door. 
Yeah, your boss may have made you do some over time, but did someone hold a knife to your throat? 
‘Boss asked me to manipulate some numbers. (I am in finance.)’– couldloseafew 
‘I was sent to the front counter where the customer service manager gave me a till and told me to open a register. Mind you I’d had ZERO training on a register (I didn’t even know how to put the till in it for f*cks sake). I told the lady this and was told to go do my job… She called me stupid in front of the customers so I handed her the till and told her to go f*ck herself.’– Daxos157 There’s over time, and then there’s over time (Picture: Pexels) 
‘Long story short, I got held up as an overnight baker by another employee. Knife to my throat, the works.’ – Morosaadvice 
‘I made the observation that perhaps we had communication difficulties.The district manager quickly snapped that I was wrong and we communicated just fine.’– niobiumnnul 
‘At my old job, this guy didn’t like his salmon burrito so he told me to ‘come closer’ like he was gonna whisper something and then he spit regurgitated salmon, tortilla and whatever else was in the burrito right onto my face.’– Loves_me_tacos125 *Retch* (Picture: Food Image Source/Getty) 
‘For my brother, it was when the boss KNEW he had no other option but to walk an hour to work, let him walk the hour in 105 degree F heat only to tell him “sorry too hot to work today! Go home.” And then call him as soon as he got back in the front door of the house and say “Changed my mind! Come back in! Btw you get to stand outside wearing the mascot costume!”‘– connietalbotfan When being in a car crash still isn’t a good enough excuse (Picture: Pexels) 
‘I received a phone call from my supervisor that I need to get to work because she had an appointment to get her hair done and couldn’t reschedule. I told reminded her that I was at a funeral and she didn’t believe me, so I took a picture of myself in front of the funeral home and sent it to her… she calls me back and says that it’s not an excuse.’– GeartheGorilla 
‘I’m a truck driver, live north of Detroit. Got back at 9am, after driving all night. Load up the car to go home, etc by 9:30am. I check in with dispatch when they inform me my next pickup is at 5pm. In Georgia. 746 miles away.’– racist_sandwich When you’re just expected to ‘learn on the job’ (Picture: Shutterstock) 
‘When my manager told me I couldn’t have the day off to go bury my mom.’– PhantomHeadshot 
‘I caught a finance manager red handed committing fraud.’– jmanpc No, I will not ‘manipulate your figures’ (Picture: Pexels) 
‘Seeing everyone else coming in late/leaving early/taking 2 hour lunches and getting ahead while I worked my ass off with no recognition. F*ck that.’– adanipse 
‘I got written up by my store manager because I was unable to keep my department’s shelves fully stocked. Because the distribution warehouse was experiencing a shortage.’– FaxCelestis 
‘I had to clean out a dumpster at one of my old jobs. In the 90 degree summer heat. After almost 2 hours of sweating my ass off, I was finally finished and told my boss. He came out, barely looked at the dumpster, and told me to do it again.’– hockeypeg18 Guns aren’t exactly a good sign (Picture: Pexels) 
‘I totaled my car driving home from work late one night. Ended up in the ER til about 4 in the morning and had to be back to work by 6. The manager was a complete d*ck and told me if I had to call someone to cover for me. So I called everyone on the phone list, no one answers because it’s 5 in the morning, I call the manager back and he says well I guess I’ll see you in an hour.’– ScullysFreckles 
‘The cute girl I was crushing on quit. To be 16 again.’– TodayKindOfSucks 
‘A manager telling me that “Daddy’s going to take care of it,” referring to himself. Incidentally, not my father.’– SayCookiesAngrily I have to clean it how many times? (Picture: Shutterstock) 
‘Worked at a shop where I was the only one of my certain race. Was told by the rest they would like to see my race “taken care of”.’– CyclingPotato 
‘I was a maintenance man at local hotel… I go in next morning and find out I am being suspended with no pay since a hooker got held at gunpoint outside her hotel room after my shift was over.’– Whats_my_age
